intro: Pleroma gracile var. hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy pleroma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. The hairy texture of its stems and leaves is a distinguishing feature of this variant.
